intro: Racosperma squamatum, commonly known as the silver wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellow pea-like flowers that are clustered in racemes. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Racosperma squamatum plays an important role in soil stabilization and is a valuable component of native vegetation in its habitat.
